subsections.title: 5.1 Purpose
subsections.content: To design and deliver a coherent, rigorous, and culturally responsive curriculum that integrates Cambridge International Education standards with Indonesian national requirements, ensuring students develop both global competencies and a strong Indonesian identity while meeting all regulatory obligations.

subsections.title: 5.2 Curriculum Design Principles
content: Standards-Based: Aligned to Cambridge learning objectives and Indonesian national curriculum standards; clear learning outcomes for each subject and grade level; assessment criteria are transparent and communicated to students.
Coherent and Sequential: Logical progression from grade to grade (vertical alignment); connections across subjects (horizontal integration); skills and knowledge build cumulatively.
Culturally Responsive: Honors Indonesian values, history, and context; embraces global perspectives and diversity; prepares students as confident Indonesian citizens and global learners.
Inquiry-Based and Student-Centered: Active learning, critical thinking, problem-solving emphasized; student agency and voice valued; differentiation for diverse learners (EAL, SEN, gifted).

Balanced: Academic rigor balanced with wellbeing and character development; breadth (exposure to multiple disciplines) and depth (mastery of core subjects); time for co-curricular activities, creativity, and rest.

subsections.title: 5.3 Cambridge Pathway Overview
subsections.content: Eduversal Partner Schools follow the Cambridge International Education pathway, which spans ages 5-19 and aligns with international best practices. Wellbeing and Social-Emotional Learning are integrated into the curriculum.

subsections.title: Stages of Cambridge Pathway
content: Stage 4: Cambridge AS & A Level (Ages 16-18, Grades 11-12)

subsections.title: 5.4 Indonesian National Curriculum Integration
subsections.content: All schools in Indonesia, including Cambridge schools, must deliver mandatory national subjects and fulfill Ministry of Education curriculum standards.

subsections.title: Mandatory National Subjects
content: 1. Pendidikan Pancasila dan Kewarganegaraan (PPKn) - Civics Education

subsections.title: 5.5 Curriculum Mapping and Scope & Sequence
subsections.content: Ensure comprehensive coverage of both the Cambridge and Indonesian curriculum requirements, with clear progression across grades.

subsections.title: 5.6 Vertical Alignment and Articulation
subsections.content: Ensure smooth transitions between grade levels and curriculum stages, avoiding gaps or excessive repetition.

subsections.title: 5.7 Horizontal Integration & Interdisciplinary Learning
subsections.content: Create connections across subjects so students see relationships and apply learning in authentic contexts.

subsections.title: 5.8 English as an Additional Language Integration
subsections.content: Comprehensive EAL support model integrated into curriculum.

subsections.title: 5.9 Differentiation for Diverse Learners
subsections.content: All students can learn and achieve high standards, but they need different pathways and supports.

subsections.title: 5.10 Use of Technology and Blended Learning
subsections.content: Enhance learning through strategic use of digital tools, while maintaining strong pedagogy and human connection.

subsections.title: 5.11 Co-Curricular and Extra-Curricular Programs
subsections.content: Extend learning beyond the classroom, develop talents, foster community, and support SLOs and Profil Pelajar Pancasila competencies.

subsections.title: 5.12 Boarding School Curriculum Considerations
subsections.content: Some Eduversal Partner Schools operate residential (boarding) programs, especially Islamic boarding schools (pesantren) integrating religious education with Cambridge curriculum.

subsections.title: 5.13 Assessment of Curriculum Effectiveness
subsections.content: Continuously evaluate whether curriculum is achieving intended outcomes (student learning, SLOs, Profil Pelajar Pancasila competencies) and make improvements.

subsections.title: 5.14 Curriculum Innovation and Continuous Improvement
subsections.content: Curriculum is not static; it evolves based on student needs, educational research, societal changes, and stakeholder input.

subsections.title: 5.16 Compliance Alignment
subsections.content: This section aligns with Cambridge Curriculum Standards, Indonesian National Curriculum, CIS Standards, WASC Category B, and Eduversal SLOs.
